WorkItem.Description:
Right now the Character Profiler and File Picker dialogs share a directory; navigating in one moves the other.
Â 
Since these two folders tend to be fairly static, would it be possible to remember two different folders for these file pickers, so one doesn't have to constantly renavigate?
WorkItem.Summary: [Feature Request] Separate file picker folders for "Save" and "Load from Character Profiler"

Comments.Message: I'm not sure what you mean... All file pickers open to the current directory, of which there is only one per application.

Let me be a bit more explicit.

I grabbed a copy of the source code I got rawr-35987.zip, which doesn't seem to be the latest
version, since the call to LoadFromProfiler() function in FileMenu_SelectionChanged() was commented
out...)  (all this is in the Rawr3/Rawr.UI/MainPage.xaml.cs file)

But in the OpenCharacter() function calls the OpenFileDialog() microsoft method.  This class is
capable of taking directory arguments, so differerent uses of the file dialog can start in different
places.

See this example: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.forms.openfiledialog.aspx

The FileDialog superclass has an InitialDirectory attribute that can be set before ShowDialog() is called.

This would allow the LoadFromProfiler() method to "maintain" a different place in the directory tree
from the "open/save" character dialogs.  This means if you both open/save a char, and load from
character profiler you would not need to renavigate the tree.
Ah, I see what you mean, sure.
